column1: Hithui was the Sindarin name for the eleventh month of the year
column2: equivalent to Quenya Hísimë and comparable to the Shire-hobbits Blotmath and modern November. Its name comes from the Elvish word for mist
column3: and it marked the descent of winter on Middle-earth. After the beginning of Hithui
column4: no long journeys were attempted in the Northlands until the arrival of the following spring.
